name: Shazam
description: A module for applying REDCap inputs into tabular or other custom layouts for surveys and data entry forms

versions.1.0.2: Bug fixes around survey shazam with labels
versions.1.1.0: Added support for widgets and multiple bug fixes
versions.1.1.1: Fixed bug reported by Mark on label option
versions.1.1.2: Fixed js saving bug and isDev bug
versions.1.1.3: Hide Shazam Setup for only design users
versions.1.1.4: Extensive bug fixing to make it more robust across questions types and survey/data entry
versions.1.1.5: Fixed issue with js passthru and ExternalModules prior to 8.4.3
versions.1.1.6: Fixed label issue with descriptive fields
versions.1.2.1: Fix release issue that made 1.2.0 really the same as 1.1.9
versions.1.3.0: Fixed issue with matrix groups, changed logging, added backup versions
versions.1.3.1: Bug fix for permissions of survey users to save updated shazam
versions.1.3.2: Another attempt at fixing matrix group formatting
versions.1.3.3: Added option to skip API url passthru
versions.1.3.4: Added option to have Shazam call a function before it renders the page so other modules can do stuff
versions.1.3.5: fixed issue around bug in em framework and emlogger integration

system-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging through this checkbox. Note that this will enable debugs for ALL Shazam projects. You can alternatively enable it on a per-project basis by going that that project's Shazam EM configuration page

Do NOT use API Endpoint for Public URLs
This should be left unchecked unless you are having issues loading js files on public surveys or if your site blocks public access to the api endpoint

Enable user whitelist for javascript editing
If checked, superusers can grant regular users the ability to edit shazam javascript on a per project basis

Email From Address
(e.g. no-reply@myredcap.com or help@myredcap.com)
If left unset, the default will be the superuser

Rejection Email Header
This field will be included in the email for rejected API requests

project-settings.name:
This module is configured by a link on the sidebar called 'Shazam Setup'.
The actual config is stored in a hidden shazam-config external module variable

Display Data History & Field Comment Log/Data Resolution Workflow Icons
You can also enable these icons for just a particular input by adding the class shazam-icons to a particular input field

Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging for this project
